intro: Ferulago asperula, commonly known as the rough fennel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Ferulago asperula is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
